title: Omicron variant could test natural immunity, vaccine protection
author: STEPHEN LOIACONI; The National Desk
description: As preliminary evidence from South Africa points to a higher risk of reinfection from the omicron variant of COVID-19, many U. S. states are already seeing signs natural immunity among the unvaccinated has begun to fade. One initial study indicates there may be a three-fold increase in the likelihood of reinfection with omicron compared to previous variants. However, those who had previous infections have experienced less severe symptoms than those who did not.
